CARDINAL . At the material time all the applicants were serving a prison sentence in correctional colony no . CARDINAL in the village of PERSON of the NORP district of LOC ( also known as facility no . IK-CARDINAL , hereinafter “ the colony ” ) .

CARDINAL . NORP In DATE a group of CARDINAL officers of a special - purpose unit , GPE , of ORG DATE now renumbered as ORG , отдел специального назначения « Варяг PERSON лесных исправительных учреждений АМ-CARDINAL/ВК-CARDINAL ) , under the command of Mr B. , arrived at the colony for the purpose of “ rendering practical assistance in maintaining the detention regime ” .

CARDINAL . Upon their arrival Mr B. and PERSON , the deputy colony director for security and operational activities , devised a plan which included the following measures : searches of the living premises , including the premises of the strict - security department ( отряд со строгими условиями содержания ) , the punishment ward ( штрафной изолятор ) and cell - like LOC ( помещения камерного типа ) ; body searches of detainees , including on their return from work ; and supervision of the detainees’ compliance with the regime regulations . The officers of the unit wore balaclava masks and carried rubber truncheons during the implementation of the plan .

CARDINAL . The applicants alleged that the unit officers had beaten detainees with truncheons and kicked and punched them . Specific allegations concerning each applicant are outlined in chronological order below .

CARDINAL . On coming back from work to the colony living premises Mr ORG learnt from other detainees that the unit officers were performing a search . The officers wore camouflage and balaclava masks . During the search they hit Mr Dedovskiy on his back CARDINAL times with a truncheon without any apparent reason and verbally assaulted him . On leaving the search LOC he received more truncheon blows .
CARDINAL . Later in the day , when going to dinner , Mr ORG , among other detainees , was told to squat down and waddle “ duck - style ” to the canteen .

CARDINAL . On coming back from work to the colony Mr PERSON was told to submit to a strip - search . PERSON , the deputy colony director , divided all the detainees into groups of CARDINAL and told them to run into the search room . Inside the room Mr PERSON was ordered to look at the floor and comply with all instructions . Any delay in fulfilling an order was met with punches to the stomach and head . Once the strip - search was completed , Mr PERSON was thrown CARDINAL - naked out into the courtyard .

CARDINAL . On coming back from work to the colony , the unit officers hit Mr Vidin on his head , neck and spine with a truncheon during their search . As a result , he could not work for an extended period of time owing to pain in his head and spine . He attempted to seek medical assistance but the medical department was closed .

CARDINAL . Later in DATE , when going to dinner , PERSON , among others , was told to squat down and waddle to the canteen . On entering the canteen and while eating the unit officers hit him in the small of his back .
CARDINAL . At the roll - call Mr GPE was beaten for having answered a unit officer ’s question too softly .

CARDINAL . Mr Gorokhov was held in cell no . CARDINAL of the strict - security department . At TIME the unit officers arrived at the department and told the detainees to go out into the corridor and to remain spread - eagled against the wall . While they were standing there , the officers punched them ; Mr Gorokhov received several blows to his liver and spine .

CARDINAL . The unit officers hit Mr ORG , among other detainees , during the wake - up and on their way to the canteen and back . He was also hit while eating . The officers allegedly hit him with a truncheon , holding it by the light end in order to increase the pain .
CARDINAL . At their work - place detainees , including PERSON , were told to form a line . The unit officers and PERSON , the security head , verbally assaulted them .

CARDINAL . NORP The unit officers allegedly told PERSON , when going to dinner , to carry another detainee on his back . Then they told all the detainees to go to the canteen in couples holding hands . PERSON was beaten for refusing to comply with these demands . After that a unit officer jumped on his back and told him to carry him to the canteen . Mr PERSON ’s refusal provoked a new round of beatings .

CARDINAL . On DATE Mr GPE , among other detainees , arrived at the colony to serve his sentence . The unit officers verbally and physically assaulted them on their way from the car to the punishment ward , where the newly arrived detainees were held . Mr PERSON and Mr T. of the colony administration were present . Later , PERSON PERSON was taken out of the cell and beaten in the corridor with truncheons . Mr T. was again present .

CARDINAL . The unit officers , accompanied by PERSON , came to the strict - security department where ORG was being held . The officers shouted at detainees as they were running out of the cells and punched them . Mr Gorokhov was hit and fell to the floor . Thereafter PERSON and his cellmates were told to stand up , strip naked and lean spread - eagled against the wall . The officers punched and kicked them and also hit them with truncheons . Mr Gorokhov collapsed several times , but when he rose to his feet the beating resumed . The officers did not make any demands or claims of the detainees . As a consequence of that treatment , PERSON had many bruises and abrasions , a headache and sharp pain in his liver .

CARDINAL . Mr PERSON was held in cell no . CARDINAL of the strict - security department ( the same cell as the sixth applicant , PERSON ) . At TIME on DATE the unit officers opened the door of their cell and put a bench in front of it . The detainees were rudely told to jump over the bench into the corridor . Mr PERSON stumbled over the bench and fell . The officers started to punch and kick him and to hit him with truncheons . In the corridor all the detainees were stripped naked and placed spread - eagled against the wall . Then the officers beat them . When Mr PERSON fell , he was made to stand up again and the beating continued . The beatings lasted for TIME .

CARDINAL . Once the unit officers had left , a doctor and a nurse entered the cell and asked whether there were any “ bedridden patients ” ( that is , who could no longer walk by themselves ) . Mr PERSON complained about sharp pains , but received no assistance .

CARDINAL . At the roll - call Mr GPE was told to step out of the line and say “ ah ” . He was beaten for saying it too softly . As a result of the beatings , Mr GPE had broken ribs . He applied to the medical department , where a doctor treated the area around the broken ribs with iodine .
CARDINAL . The unit officers took Mr GPE , among other detainees , out of the cell and into the corridor , where he was spread - eagled against the wall and beaten .

CARDINAL . Mr GPE , among other detainees , was taken out of the cell into the corridor , where the unit officers punched and kicked them and also hit them with truncheons . Mr F. and PERSON , were also present , in an inebriated state .

CARDINAL . At TIME the unit officers , together with Mr F. and Mr T. , arrived at the strict - security department where Mr GPE had been transferred from the punishment ward on TIME . All the detainees , including the fifth applicant , were told to run out of the cells into the corridor . The unit officers punched and kicked Mr GPE and beat him with truncheons . CARDINAL . Mr GPE alleges that he had brain concussion . In DATE he was diagnosed with traumatic psychopathy in prison hospital GPE MOB , which he believes to be a consequence of the beating on DATE .

NORP The report on the use of a rubber truncheon of DATE indicated that “ the rubber truncheon was used because at the rouse at CARDINAL a.m. the convict GPE , along with other convicts , did not fulfil the get - up command . PERSON and his cellmates were taken out into the corridor where the officers punched and kicked them and also hit them with truncheons . Thereafter he was allegedly refused medical assistance in the medical department of the colony .

CARDINAL . The report on the use of a rubber truncheon of DATE indicated that “ the rubber truncheon was used because at the rouse ... the convict PERSON did not get up . When ordered to get up and dress , he reacted reluctantly and failed to dress in accordance with the established form of dress . When told to change his clothes and assume the normal look , he did not react , but behaved rudely and tactlessly towards the officers ” . The report was signed by CARDINAL colony officials and PERSON

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG handed CARDINAL complaints of ill - treatment written by the colony detainees to ORG ( ORG по правам человека в Пермской области , hereinafter “ the ORG ” ) . The ORG provided the Perm Regional prosecutor with copies of the complaints and requested factual information from the colony administration . On DATE the ORG town prosecutor in charge of supervision of compliance with laws in penitentiary institutions opened a criminal investigation into an offence under LAW of LAW ( excess of power involving the use of weapons or special means ) .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG decided to form a public commission for the investigation of the causes and circumstances of the events in colony AM CARDINAL/CARDINAL - CARDINAL . The commission included the ORG , the director of ORG and a representative of ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG visited the colony and talked to the detainees who had lodged the complaints . The majority of them confirmed their statements .
CARDINAL . On DATE the director of facility no . ORG replied to the ORG ’s request for information as follows :

“ The measures ... with the involvement of the special - purpose unit officers ... were carried out from DATE ] on the basis of LAW and they were not extraordinary ... RP-CARDINAL [ rubber truncheons ] were used on detainees who refused to comply ... The mass lodging of complaints about allegedly unlawful actions of the unit officers has been arranged by a criminal leader ... ”

CARDINAL . On DATE the director and other employees of ORG visited the colony . They were allowed to take photos and talked to CARDINAL detainees in private . The findings were reported to the Ombudsman in the following manner :

“ Conclusion : there is no reason not to trust the allegations of the detainees . For DATE detainees were severely beaten while returning from work , in the canteen ... in the punishment ward , in the cell - like premises ... detainees were made to squat and waddle and then jump up again ... they were stripped naked before the search ... It is conceivable that the special - purpose unit was called upon to intimidate [ detainees ] in the wake of a conflict between the colony administration and the criminal leader . However , no matter how subversive the ringleader ’s influence on other detainees might have been , this can not in any way justify the unit ’s actions ... especially taking into account that a majority of detainees in the colony are ... unconnected to organised crime . It appears that the detainees were , as usual , ‘ collateral damage’ of an extremely complicated and entangled relationship between the management of the correctional institution and criminal leaders . ”

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG paid another visit to the colony and talked to CARDINAL detainees . Of those , CARDINAL detainees confirmed their initial allegations and indicated that they had given the same statements to investigators from the prosecutor ’s office . The ORG found a number of violations of the colony regime , such as belated provision of medical assistance in the punishment ward and cell - like LOC , lack of water and lack of remedies against disciplinary sanctions imposed by the colony administration .

CARDINAL . In DATE and DATE Mr PERSON , the head of the department for supervision of compliance with laws in penitentiary institutions , which is a department of ORG , arrived in PERSON for a special inquiry . The ORG refused to produce a copy of his report requested by ORG ( see paragraphs CARDINAL and CARDINAL below ) . According to the applicants , he found that ( i ) the unit officers had used rubber truncheons unlawfully ; ( ii ) when performing their duties , the unit officers should not have worn balaclava masks ; ( iii ) the quality of the pre - trial investigation had been unsatisfactory ; and ( iv ) a few detainees had been unlawfully placed in the punishment ward . The ORG town prosecutor was disciplined and the materials of the investigation were transferred to the NORP Regional prosecutor .

CARDINAL . On DATE Mr B. , the head of the special - purpose unit , was charged with an offence under LAW of LAW . On DATE he was additionally charged under LAW ( undue performance of professional duties entailing a substantial impairment of ORG rights and interests ) .
CARDINAL . On DATE a prosecutor discontinued criminal proceedings against PERSON subordinates , officers of the special - purpose unit , finding as follows :

“ In the period from DATE ] the employees of the special - purpose unit AM-CARDINAL stayed at the colony , executing the deputy head ’s request to carry out the planned preventive and regime measures on detainees of the colony IK-CARDINAL . When carrying out these measures , officers of the unit used rubber truncheons on the detainees .

The investigation has taken all measures to determine the part of each unit officer in the events ; however , the victims and witnesses were not able to identify the unit officers who had beaten them because they had worn identical camouflage and balaclava masks . Thus , the investigation has not obtained any objective information which would permit charges to be brought against any unit officers . ”

CARDINAL . On DATE the same prosecutor discontinued the criminal proceedings in respect of the complaints lodged by the second , third and fourth applicants and CARDINAL other detainees , finding that “ the investigation had not obtained any objective information confirming these detainees’ allegations of the use of rubber truncheons by the special - purpose unit ” .

DATE . On DATE the same prosecutor discontinued criminal proceedings against PERSON on the charge of excess of power . The prosecutor noted that PERSON had not used a rubber truncheon himself and had not given orders to use one . The remaining charge of professional misconduct was referred for trial .
CARDINAL . On DATE the public commission was disbanded because the case had gone to trial .

CARDINAL . DATE the ORG of GPE held public hearings in the criminal case against PERSON , accused of professional misconduct under LAW . In total , QUANTITY detainees were granted victim status in the criminal proceedings ; of these , QUANTITY persons took part in the hearings and written depositions by the others were read out before the court . The court took witness statements from CARDINAL other detainees who had not been victims themselves .

CARDINAL . The trial concerned CARDINAL counts . In counts CARDINAL to CARDINAL twelve detainees were beaten during searches on CARDINAL and DATE . In count CARDINAL detainees , including the seventh applicant , were hit with rubber truncheons . CARDINAL detainees were hit with truncheons at the roll - call on DATE ( count CARDINAL ) . On DATE Mr B. ’s subordinates beat CARDINAL detainees , including the first applicant , who were returning from work ( count CARDINAL ) and CARDINAL other detainees during a search in the punishment ward ( count CARDINAL) . In count CARDINAL the fifth and sixth applicants , as well as CARDINAL other detainees , were beaten with truncheons during the wake - up . Finally , another detainee received a truncheon blow on DATE ( count CARDINAL ) .

CARDINAL . Before the court the applicants maintained their claims . The court decided , however , that their allegations were contradicted by the reports on the use of rubber truncheons ( cited above ) and witness statements by representatives of the colony administration .

CARDINAL . The employees of the colony , including PERSON and PERSON , as well as PERSON subordinates , denied any unjustified use of rubber truncheons on detainees . The colony doctor confirmed that a few detainees had applied for medical assistance after they had been hit with truncheons ; however , no one had had broken ribs or been in a serious condition . Nor had medical assistance been refused to anyone . The CARDINAL detainees heard by the court corroborated the statements by the other victims .
CARDINAL . On DATE the trial court delivered judgment . It acquitted Mr B. of the charges , finding as follows :

“ Under LAW and LAW , employees of penitentiary institutions may use special means , including rubber truncheons , in cases of persistent disobedience to the lawful demands of the colony staff ... The court has established that ... all demands ... were lawful . In all cases the use of [ rubber truncheons ] was justified because they were used after ... a warning of the intention to use a [ truncheon ] and because they were used when the victims refused to execute lawful demands of the staff , that is , disobedience to the colony staff ... Each use of the [ truncheon ] was reported to B. if he was absent during its application ... There are therefore no grounds to consider that [ B. ] did not exercise appropriate control over the lawfulness of the actions of his subordinates and in that way unduly performed his duties .

Nor did the court establish violations of rights and lawful interests of citizens who are the victims in the present case ... [ T]he court considers that damage to their health was caused on lawful grounds ...

[ T]he court also takes into account that criminal proceedings against the unit officers were discontinued for lack of evidence of a criminal offence ... That decision has not been quashed . It does not , in itself , confirm the lawfulness of the unit ORG actions ... but it prevents [ the court ] from establishing the facts of unlawful actions . ”

CARDINAL . NORP The prosecution and CARDINAL victims appealed against the acquittal . The prosecution submitted , in particular , that the trial court had based its judgments on the statements by the defendant , his subordinates and the colony administration and disregarded submissions by the detainees . It pointed out factual discrepancies : thus , according to the statements by PERSON ’s subordinates , they had used truncheons CARDINAL times , but PERSON had signed CARDINAL reports on the use of special means . Moreover , it noted that the infliction of physical pain and bodily injuries had clearly violated the GPE right and lawful interests and that the trial court had failed to identify lawful grounds for the use of physical force and special means .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG examined the points of appeal and upheld the judgment of DATE . It noted that Mr B. had played a “ merely nominal ” part in the events and that he had not been able , or obliged , to control the conduct of each unit officer in his absence . He had not given orders to use truncheons and he had not used them himself . The appellate court held that in these circumstances the acquittal on the charge of undue performance of professional duties had been lawful and justified . It further noted that the investigative bodies had discontinued the proceedings against PERSON on the charge of excess of power and against his subordinates for the lack of evidence of a criminal offence and it was not therefore required to rule on those issues .
CARDINAL . Further to the ORG ’s request , the ORG submitted handwritten and typed copies of the applicants’ medical records .

CARDINAL . Detainees and the premises where they live may be searched ( Article CARDINAL § § CARDINAL and CARDINAL ) .

CARDINAL . Physical force , special means or weapons may be used against detainees if they offer resistance to the officers , persistently disobey lawful demands of the officers , engage in riotous conduct , take part in mass disorders , take hostages , attack individuals or commit other publicly dangerous acts , escape from the penitentiary institution or attempt to harm themselves or others ( Article CARDINAL § CARDINAL ) . The procedure for application of these security measures is determined in the NORP legislation ( Article CARDINAL § CARDINAL ) .
CARDINAL . When using physical force , special means or weapons , the penitentiary officers must :
( CARDINAL ) NORP state their intention to use them and afford the detainee(s ) sufficient time to comply with their demands unless a delay would imperil life or limb of the officers or detainees ;
( CARDINAL ) NORP ensure the least possible harm to detainees and provide medical assistance ;
( CARDINAL ) report every incident involving the use of physical force , special means or weapons to their immediate superiors ( section CARDINAL ) .
CARDINAL . Rubber truncheons may be used for
( CARDINAL ) putting an end to assaults on officers , detainees or civilians ;

( CARDINAL ) NORP repressing mass disorders or group violations of public order by detainees , as well as for apprehension ( задержание ) of offenders who persistently disobey or resist the officers ( section CARDINAL ) .

CARDINAL . If criminal proceedings are discontinued at the stage of the investigation , a victim or a civil party may lodge a separate civil claim unless the proceedings were discontinued on the ground that ( a ) the alleged offence had not been committed ( otsutstvie sobytiya prestupleniya ) or ( b ) the suspect had not been involved in its commission ( LAW and LAW ( CARDINAL ) and CARDINAL § CARDINAL ( CARDINAL ) ) .

CARDINAL . If the defendant is acquitted by the trial court on the ground that ( a ) the alleged offence was not committed or ( b ) the defendant was not involved in its commission , the trial court will dismiss the civil claim . If the defendant is acquitted on the ground that CARDINAL or more constituent elements of a criminal offence are missing ( LAW ( CARDINAL ) ) , the trial court will disallow the civil claim but it may be lodged again in separate civil proceedings ( LAW ) .
